title: Space in path prevents build

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
I'm trying to build rust from commit 4a24f08ba43166cfee86d868b3fe8612aec6faca by running `x.py build`, but keep getting the build error `c++: error: TB/repositories/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/llvm/build/./lib: No such file or directory`.  I've pasted the complete build output towards the bottom of this but report, but the issue is that I have a space in my path; the complete path to the location the build system is looking for is `/mnt/2.0 TB/repositories/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/llvm/build/./lib`.  

Dealing with it is trivial, just rename paths to not have spaces, but this *is* annoying so if it's an easy fix it should be fixed.  If it's difficult, then just put a note somewhere that paths cannot have whitespace in them.  Better yet, modify `x.py` to verify that there aren't any spaces in the path, and quit with an error message if there are any.

### The bug in full

```bash
cfkaran2@Hammer:/mnt/2.0 TB/repositories/rust$ ./x.py build && ./x.py test
```
